block.p: I agree that we need fire standards for cigarettes (editorial, May 3), but state legislatures should also legislate responsibility for sidewalk cleanup to tobacco companies. Cigarette butts are not discarded in trash cans; they are normally flipped onto the sidewalks. Butts are strewn all over city sidewalks every morning, and sweepers must collect them individually. Amend the state fire standards bill to cover the cost of butt cleanups.
FRANCIS E. DYER New York, May 3, 2000
